question:
$$\frac{1}{r} = \frac{1}{4} + \frac{1}{9} + \frac{1}{36} + 2 \sqrt{\frac{1}{4 \cdot 9} + \frac{1}{4 \cdot 36} + \frac{1}{9 \cdot 36}}$$

$$\frac{1}{r} = \frac{1}{4} + \frac{1}{9} + \frac{1}{36} + 2 \sqrt{\frac{1}{36} + \frac{1}{144} + \frac{1}{324}}$$

$$\frac{1}{r} = \frac{1}{4} + \frac{1}{9} + \frac{1}{36} + 2 \cdot \frac{1}{6} \sqrt{1 + 4 + 9}$$

$$\frac{1}{r} = \frac{1}{4} + \frac{1}{9} + \frac{1}{36} + \frac{1}{3} \sqrt{14}$$

$$\frac{1}{r} = \frac{9 + 4 + 1}{36} + \frac{1}{3} \sqrt{14}$$

$$\frac{1}{r} = \frac{14}{36} + \frac{1}{3} \sqrt{14}$$

$$\frac{1}{r} = \frac{7}{18} + \frac{1}{3} \sqrt{14}$$

$$r = \frac{18}{7 + 2 \sqrt{14}}$$

$$r = \frac{18 \cdot (7 - 2 \sqrt{14})}{7^2 - (2 \sqrt{14})^2}$$

$$r = \frac{126 - 36 \sqrt{14}}{49 - 56}$$

$$r = \frac{126 - 36 \sqrt{14}}{-7} = $$

$$r = -18 + \frac{54}{\sqrt{14}}$$

$$\boxed{r = -18 + \frac{54}{\sqrt{14}}. \space I \space hope \space it \space is \space correct.}$$
